Well at least I *think* it's complete.

After a 4 hour marathon debugging session I squished the pile of bugs,
errors and other oddities that were in all the code I'd written for the last
quarter, and as far as I can tell that happened to be all of them.

I've tested it only on DPH's torture scenario 666 (Really really easy to
work out what's going wrong when it starts crashing :) and nothing else,
however it should work in all situations since that scenario covers most of
them.

I will do some more testing tomorrow, as well as produce the documentation
DPH requested, but for now you can go play with the program at
www.twarriors.com/deathifier
It's still a debug build, so it's still kinda large (it grew by 15k since
last time) however once I've tested it tomorrow I'll replace it with a
retail build with the internal logger turned off.
At the same time that build and the documenation goes up I'll also put up
the source code.

If you want to help test it simply run it, put through a scenario file, then
put the resulting text file back through and see if it still runs in
gladiator :)
You can even try putting the scenario file back through again.

The only difference between the files produced is that the scenario files
have a .FSS extension normally, but when they come out it's in lower case -
.fss
The game doesn't seem to care though :)

WARNING: Converting WILL overwrite any other file of the same name, the way
it works is this:
It takes the file you gave it as input, strips off the extension, and
appends the extension of what your converting to.
So .txt -> .fss and .fss -> .txt
Now if you test it by converting back and forth a few times it is *really*
important that you make a backup of your scenarios, otherwise if there is a
bug in the program in the parts that are actually writing the file you'll
end up with some form of corrupt file, which is totally useless, and no way
of getting the original back aside from re-extracting it from wherever you
got it.

On that note, if you do find a bug, make a note of any error boxes that pop
up, any exceptions that occur (one tends to follow the other...) or, if it's
an error in how a file is written out, a short description of what is wrong.
Then send that, along with the file you were trying to convert to me and
I'll find and fix the bug :)

Enjoy,
Deathifier
